unit: Unit 8 | Inference for Categorical Data: Chi-Square
title: Name the Test
question_text: What type of inferential procedure could be used to investigate data taken from a single sample, that can be represented in a two-way table that is $2 \times 2$ or larger?
solution:
A chi-squared test for association is best used as an inference procedure for a two-way table with data from a single sample. When the table is $2 \times 2$, a two-proportion $Z$-test could also be used, but only if a table is $2 \times 2$.

A chi-squared test for association can be used for $2 \times 2$ tables AND larger tables involving $2$ categorical variables. For example, one could investigate if there is an association between race (categorical variable #1) and political party preference (categorical variable #2).

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'B'.
